item.title: Aliens Vs. Predator demo
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

Close combat kills are awsome, especially when a predator goes and trophy kills a marine which gives me enough time to creep in behind and headbite him.

1.Controls are easy enough to tweak yourself, it’s under keyboard config in the options I think. unless your talking about something else which then I don’t understand, cause I found them to be fine except alien’s transition.

2.I understand what you mean here, I think there was a guy spawncamping in the last server I played. Its not a grandly big issue though.

3.NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO.(this was typed out completly without copypasta or capslock to just show how much I feel about nerf games.:|)

all in all, I like everything eccept actually finding a game. having it do that for you is a serious pain in the ass. If I wanted the game to do everything for me I’d be playing on a console. I’m also not looking through nostagia goggles as I have never played any avp before this except the avp2 demo.

Just wanted to say that the second playtest went much better. It was probably just that I ran into a game where people had already gotten good at it and I was still learning the controls. This time around it was a lot of fun, controls felt good, damage was good, I was able to rack up kills as all species and win a couple rounds. So, pretty much the only bad thing was the spawn point thing. Aliens are still tricky to play but I don’t think it’s the game’s fault, probably just I couldn’t use it too well.

Also, the predator stealth kills on marines are super brutal. Most gruesome I’ve seen in a while. I don’t mind some blood and gore but stuff like ripping a marine’s head off is a bit much for me :sick:

Read full topic

item.title: Aliens Vs. Predator demo

item.description:
It is fun! Getting the controls down was a cinch and the marines can actually hold their own once you can counter the pred’s and alien’s light attacks.

item.title: Aliens Vs. Predator demo
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Alright, so I finally got used to the controls and now the game is fun.

The only real problem now is a lack of players per game, though I guess this will be resolved if the game’s community is large enough, and raising the player count to 18 players couldn’t hurt either.

item.title: Aliens Vs. Predator demo
item.dc:creator: Rossman
item.description:
The game’s not bad at all, but of coarse I’m playing it on xbox. The controls on the alien are a little wonky at first but once you get a few kills you get right into it. If you have troubles with the wall climbing with the alien just turn on the auto transition setting. I think it works quite well. The only thing wrong is finding the game. IT TAKES FOREVER.

Read full topic

item.title: Aliens Vs. Predator demo
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
Close combat kills are awsome, especially when a predator goes and trophy kills a marine which gives me enough time to creep in behind and headbite him.

Orpheon:

So if they can 1) tweak the controls, 2) fix the spawning system, and 3) nerf damage a bit to make the fights last longer I’d be interested. Right now if a fight takes a while it’s because the players can’t find and hit each other (especially seems a problem for aliens). It looks quite nice, a good atmosphere, models, animations, etc., but without good programming and innovation its just eye-candy. Of course I know it’s pre-release code but this is what I think needs to be done. I also would like to see how the single-player goes. In a lot of SP/MP games the SP is much better.

1.Controls are easy enough to tweak yourself, it’s under keyboard config in the options I think. unless your talking about something else which then I don’t understand, cause I found them to be fine except alien’s transition.

2.I understand what you mean here, I think there was a guy spawncamping in the last server I played. Its not a grandly big issue though.

3.NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO.(this was typed out completly without copypasta or capslock to just show how much I feel about nerf games.:|)

all in all, I like everything eccept actually finding a game. having it do that for you is a serious pain in the ass. If I wanted the game to do everything for me I’d be playing on a console. I’m also not looking through nostagia goggles as I have never played any avp before this except the avp2 demo.

item.title: Aliens Vs. Predator demo
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Let’s see, first impressions…

So far I don’t like it much. When I finally got connected to a game, I found the controls were a little unresponsive and awkward but not hard to figure out. However, it did feel like getting good with them was going to be a challenge. And yet I’d run into people and die in a second or less. And I’d also spawn right next to someone who of course would kill me instantly.

So if they can 1) tweak the controls, 2) fix the spawning system, and 3) nerf damage a bit to make the fights last longer I’d be interested. Right now if a fight takes a while it’s because the players can’t find and hit each other (especially seems a problem for aliens). It looks quite nice, a good atmosphere, models, animations, etc., but without good programming and innovation its just eye-candy. Of course I know it’s pre-release code but this is what I think needs to be done. I also would like to see how the single-player goes. In a lot of SP/MP games the SP is much better.

P.S. As I play more I may find that the controls are fine but first impression is somewhat clunky. Also it’s FFA only right now and I prefer teams, so those who prefer FFA may think the gameplay is fine.

Read full topic
